flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

lines.text: Processing native clay is simple. The basic concept, is to achieve an end  product for fired ceramics using  the fewest steps. Some steps are unavoidable however, such as  finding a suitable clay vein to process. Native or earthenware clay can be found just about anywhere, but your best bet is to investigate nearby creeks or riverbeds. Fortunately, here in southeast Ohio clay is so abundant you can literally dig it out of your own back yard. During a landscaping project on our small city lot in downtown Zanesville, we discovered a clay vein under the hill directly behind our home.

guide.summary: Dig your own! If you know a place to find clay then this guide will help you process it with stuff found in your home.
